        activateBioFingerprintMode, activateBiometricMode, authenticateWithBioFingerprint, authenticateWithBiometric, changePin, deActivateBioFingerprintMode, deActivateBiometricMode, getType, isBioFingerprintModeActivated, isBiometricModeActivated

    • Method Detail

      • getOtpMode1

        String getOtpMode1(@NonNull
                   String pinText,
                   @NonNull
                   String challenge,
                   @Nullable
                   String amount,
                   @Nullable
                   Currency currencyCode)
            throws FastTrackException
        Get mode 1 OTP with PIN.
        Parameters:
        pinText - The PIN text
        challenge - The merchant challenge: An unpredictable number of up to 8 Hexadecimal digits
        amount - The amount. If isMode1AmountRequired() returns true the argument is required. Otherwise the argument is ignored.
        currencyCode - The currency of the transaction. If isMode1CurrencyRequired() returns true the argument is required. Otherwise the argument is ignored.
        Returns:
        The OTP value
        Throws:
        FastTrackException - The exception when storage operation fails.

        amount - The amount. If isMode1AmountRequired() returns true the argument is required. Otherwise the argument is ignored.
        currencyCode - The currency of the transaction. If isMode1CurrencyRequired() returns true the argument is required. Otherwise the argument is ignored.

        The OTP value
        Throws:

      • getOtpMode2Tds

        String getOtpMode2Tds(@NonNull
                      String pinText,
                      @NonNull
                      List<String> dataToSign)
               throws FastTrackException
        Creates a mode 2 transaction data signature OTP with PIN.

        The typical use case of this mode is for signing a set of transaction data. One such example is to sign the destination bank account in a transaction.

        Parameters:
        pinText - The PIN text
        dataToSign - The list of data to be signed, data should only contain digits, maximum 10 digit per data and maximum 10 data fields in the list; at least one non-empty data is required.
        Returns:
        The OTP
        Throws:
        FastTrackException - The exception when storage operation fails.

      • getOtpMode2Tds

        String getOtpMode2Tds(@NonNull
                      ProtectorAuthInput authInput,
                      @NonNull
                      List<String> dataToSign)
               throws FastTrackException
        Creates a mode 2 transaction data signature OTP with auth input.

        The typical use case of this mode is for signing a set of transaction data. One such example is to sign the destination bank account in a transaction.

        Parameters:
        authInput - The auth input
        dataToSign - The list of data to be signed, data should only contain digits, maximum 10 digit per data and maximum 10 data fields in The list; at least one non-empty data is required.
        Returns:
        The OTP
        Throws:
        FastTrackException - The exception when storage operation fails.

      • isMode1AmountRequired

        boolean isMode1AmountRequired()
        Check if amount is required for a mode 1 OTP operation (getOtpMode1(String, String, String, Currency)).

        This method is affected by the IAF value. For example, an IAF of 0x70 does not include the amount while 0xA0 includes

        Returns:
        true if amount is required

      • isMode1CurrencyRequired

        boolean isMode1CurrencyRequired()
        Check if currency is required for a mode 1 OTP operation (getOtpMode1(String, String, String, Currency)).

        This method is affected by the IAF value. For example, an IAF of 0x70 does not include the currency while 0x80 includes

        Returns:
        true if currency is required
